comment: One of the absolute best professors I have had. While the course material is difficult and she is not afraid to challenge you, she explains the content in very helpful ways and is willing to answer any and all questions. Provides great tips for students moving into the accounting profession.

Dr. Hermanson is hands down the best professor I had at KSU. Yes, there are a lot of notes, but she provides amazing study tools, which if you use them, mirror the exams. I put the time in to study, and made nearly a 100 on all of the exams. She cares about her students, and took the time to help me succeed in class and my career. She is worth it.

This is the class that turned me away from continuing my Accounting Major. Have to take note of EVERYTHING she says. You do a lot of Connect homework and yet feel unprepared for the quiz OR exams. I spent hours studying for exams and still only averaged a D on them, barely passing. Turned it into a business elective for my new Marketing Major.

The class is not easy, but it doesn't have anything to do with the professor. There is a ton of material. If you do not study outside of class you will not pass. She tells you that from day one. Come to class, show that you are making an effort and you should do okay. The material though is just hard.

is an ok professor. she hurries through the notes and leaves you wondering what just happened in class.  take really really good notes and attend class and also use resources outside of class to ensure you really understand the concepts. Alex software program left me soo pissed and frustrated so start it early and finish early. I hated this class.

Professor Hermann truly cares about her students and provides a ton of study materials and resources to help you. She is a great accounting advisor as well and I highly recommend her. This class is TOUGH, though. Don't expect to not study and pass.

Hermanson was a really good teacher but the bottom line is that this class is really hard. If you want to do well in this class you need to show up to class (but attendance isnt mandatory) and do the homework and the extra stuff. There were 4 tests, several quizzes, and a big online project thing (not as bad as it sounds). Overall I recommend her.
Explains concept in logical manner. Shares custom alternatives to methods in text. Wants everyone to do well. She is awesome!

Ms. H is a knows her stuff. There is t so much content crammed in one class, so be prepared to spend at 15 hours a week outside class if you want an A. For a weed out class, she is very helpful and she genuinely cares about you passing. This was the hardest B ever, but I didnt put as much time outside of class as I should have. UTILIZE OFFICE HOURS

DR. H is a great accounting professor and is respected by me. She is very knowledgeable and helpful for sitting for a CPA test. I studied her class like preparing my college entrance exam. If you prepared and practiced, it is usual for you to get an A. I got a high A in her class AND will wait to take her auditing class when available.

She's such a sweet lady it's very hard to dislike her. As much as you want to give up she doesn't let you. Hardest class ever I studied like never before. Get ready to come to class n read before hand too. Very helpful teacher n I respect her for not giving up on me!

Dr. Hermanson is great! I still haven't gotten my grade as of yet but I really respect her as a professor. That being said, this is the HARDEST class I have ever taken in my entire life. I generally don't do a lot of studying but I study my ass off in this class and you will too. But she is always willing to help and I really appreciate that.
shes a good teacher, but she can throw a lot of material at you at once and it takes awhile for it too make sense. very hard class, by no means should you take this class lightly.

This is a HARD class and Dr. Hermanson won't spoon feed you. Her exams are NO JOKE! You need to study your butt off for those! She twists the questions so you have to think, but she's only preparing you for the mindset required to pass the CPA exams and succeed in the accounting profession. She's very helpful. Just ask.

She is a great professor.  I would take her for every accounting class if I could. Her tests are HARD but she gives you all the resources and advice you need to do well. If you don't study hard or come to class you will not do well.  I practiced problems and studied almost every day and made an A.

This is the acct weed out class and is HARD if you don't put the work in. The prof provides tons of resources with solutions to all the problems in the book, connect, Learn Smart and problems in D2L. Gives generous curves on some tests and partial credit on problems. Very helpful and approachable at office hours. Be prepared to work for your grade.

All I can say is be prepared to study harder than you ever have for any class before. If you slack in this class...you will pay. On the first test several students walked away with 40% and she straight up told them to drop. She has tough love and you earn your keep..no freebies. I got an 89 in the class...after lots of hard work. Just be prepared

This class is hard!  It's called the weed out class for a reason.  Dr. H is a great teacher who really knows what she's talking about. I learned a lot. Homework is not required, but I suggest you do it since that's where she gets her test questions from.  You need to understand the concepts, don't just memorize .  I worked my butt off for a B

This is a difficult class bc it's the largest leap from regular 2000-level ACCT courses to the intense ACCT-major courses. Dr. Hermanson was the best professor to teach this course. She's very helpful, will work with you outside of class, and is very intelligent. Go to class. Missing even one class will put you far behind. The textbook is crucial.

This class is ridiculously difficult. I'm an A student but made C's on the first 2 tests(I ended up dropping the class). Don't take her if you work or have other hard classes. You'll need PLENTY of time outside class to study. She even says you need to study 10 hrs outside of class per week. She definitely knows acct forwards and backwards though.

This is a very difficult class to begin with. The way she explains this can be confusing at times. You MUST read the chapters and do all the homework if you want to pass the class. Her reviews are very vague and the tests are HARD. By the end of the semester half my class had dropped! I would only take 4 classes total while taking this course.

She is a great professor to take if you are majoring in Accounting.  The class itself is no joke.  I earned an A but it took a lot of studying and time to get the material.  The book is huge and must read to get a good grade in the class. Overall Professor H is great she gives handouts on each chapter and goes over the material well.

She is an excellent professor who truly cares about her students and does her best to clarify this subject. The class is a HUGE jump from the intro classes but with some hard work an A is definitely attainable. She is very knowledgeable and always willing to answer questions and help in any way she can. Highly recommend this professor.

She is a nice professor, but honestly if your professor tells you that it is normal for her to curve your whole class test grade by 25 points there is something wrong with her teaching method and she needs to fix it.  I thought I understood financial accounting, but when I took this class she just confused me.

If you're serious about Accounting,take 3100 with Hermanson. Her class will prepare you for the future. Tests aren't that bad if you actually read the book, work the problems, and study. If you can't make it through her class, you should reconsider Accounting --this is only the beginning.

She knows her stuff. She tries to intimidate you at the beginning of the semester but if you study and practice using your notes and her online resources you will be fine. 3 exams are worth 200pts each, final is worth 300pts cumulative, and 100 for combined HW. She curves exams but make sure you study for her(1/3 multiple choice 2/3 problems)

I took Hermanson during a Maymester. I passed the class with a B in 8 days. I'm not sure why everyone complains about how hard the class is. I'm sure this isn't the first time that it has been brought to your attention that accounting isn't the easiest subject. If you want to learn and gain a strong basis in accounting, take Hermanson.

Extremely hard class but best prof I've had at KSU. If you are an accounting major this is the only professor you should consider. She will prepare you for all 4000 level classes and cpa exam. 3 tests and cumulative final. Don't even bother taking one of her test if you don't know absolutely everything in the book. You will fail miserably. Gd Luck!

Awful! She is negative and has a poor attitude. Ditto the 2 comments below. There are 3 tests, online HW, and a cumulative final. The tests are hard, I mean like memorize the book. She is a good teacher but the problems in class an in HW are not like the ones on the test. Tests are curved but there is no chance for extra credit or bonus points.

I think she should learn how to be a good person first than  know how to teach.She is a VERY negative person.As a professor,she likes to discourage you and let you down.Class is like a competition, she is the winner, everyone is the loser.I really can't stand her attitude.Just Stay away from her, if you want to have a good mood.

Class makes Mad Max's Thunder Dome Look Tame! She constantly says that if you are struggling to give up on being an accountant. Tests didn't match the material taught in class. 2/3 of my entire class dropped out because of her insanely difficult and long tests. Class was about failing her students in order to enlarge her overly inflated ego.

Class is a nightmare. Basically everything in the book is fair game for a test. She's nice, but will encourage you to switch your major to something else if you're struggling. Acts like it only gets worse after this class but it doesn't, only accounting class I've made a C in. Tests are long and extremely difficult. Informative professor but beware

She was a great professor.  Unfortunately I didn't take advantage of it and skipped too many classes and got a C.  Take advantage of her classes for future financial acct classes.  Intermediate 2 and Advanced are difficult!!

By far the worst accounting teacher I have ever had. The test are extremely hard and you will spend a lot of hours studying for her test and you will still not get a B. Her test are extremely long and you have to rush to finish each test. She doesn't like people asking questions in class cause she has so much to teach during the time period.

She is super nice but her tests are very difficult because you can't figure out what she wants. If you do take her, if you have no choice, have someone copy notes of what she writes on the board, someone copy what she is saying (because there is key info there she doesn't write) & pay close attention to the wording of the questions on your test.

Sweet professor!! She's always willing to help students. Yes, exams are hard as hell but she curves a lot so no biggie. If you are an accounting major, take her. You will learn so much more from her than other professors!

Hard class, but great teacher. Must study for tests as doing the homework alone will not prepare you. She's very helpful and willing to do what it takes, but you have to be the one to let her know you need help.

Sweet professor & she knows her stuff. The only issue I had was the test material not adding up to the material taught in class. I suggest you take another professor because if you fail the test or do bad on it she doesn't help you she just encourages you to give up be an accountant. Save yourself the trouble & don't take her class.

I took her for Acct 2100. Every Accounting 2100 class requires the same online HW, and the tests are from the department- not made by her. Class overall is sort of tricky, but she is VERY helpful. Disregard that other comment, because when I took additional accounting courses with other professors, she even helped me then on her own time too.

It's a hard class & she is sweet but what she teaches does not add up to test material. On test day its like looking at a foreign language. Don't take her class she will talk you out of being an acct major just bc you don't understand what she is teaching to translate on ur test. Run save yourself the trouble. Take a professor who will help u. Run!

She is very approachable and easy to talk to. She is so sweet, however, her teaching doesnt add up to what she puts in tests. Homework is lengthy, yet all ACCT2100 classes have the same online homework. Again, she is very nice, however the subject is already difficult, and she moves at a very fast pace.

There is a lot of material to cover in this course, and she covers everything with crystal clarity. Very willing to help anyone who asks. Tests are pretty tricky though; READ CAREFULLY! Do all work and additional practice work she gives as many times as possible, and you will get an A.

Let me just say that I have never received a grade lower than a B EVER. I took Acct. 2100 with Prof. Sheil and got a D. This is an extremely difficult standardized class. Tests are VERY DIFFICULT. I took this class the 2nd time with Prof. Hermanson and she is AMAZING. Very high school like teaching method which helps ALOT in learning the material.
Decent professor.  Extremely difficult class.  Easy homework grades but tests are crazy hard.  You should definitely attend every class.  If you miss one, you'll be lost.

She does NOT explain anything clearly and than she gets frustrated when you don't understand and ask her to re-explain. She doesn't use the computer to present the class notes and you'd be better off reading a monkeys handwriting than hers at any point. Its just a sad thing that she chose to teach a tough subject and to do it poorly.

My favorite Prof. so far! She was so so helpful and a nice person in general. She understands ACCT is tough so she tries to make it easy as possible. She gives lots of extra credit points, and I think she rounded my grade up, so stick it out!! I definitely recommend her. Gives easy homework grades, just do it and its ~5 points of your final grade

She is a great teacher, always willing to help with anything inside or outside of class, and will do anything she can to help you as long as she knows you want it. That said, DO THE MULIPLE CHOICE PRACTICE QUIZZES ON THE BOOK WEBSITE. If you work them and understand the material, the quizzes will not be too difficult. Otherwise, you will fail acct.

The difficulty of the class is not controlled by the instructor. This is a standardized class with all sections taking the same multiple choice exams. I found this instructor to be VERY clear and comprehensive. She moves fast but the class covers a lot of material. Would  definitely take her again if possible. I just wish she taught 2200...
No Comments
she doesn't make the subject harder than it is, but her tests are kindof difficult.  but she is willing to help you and explains the material really well to you.  lots of work on the internet!
